pageProps.body:
Prediction in Complex Systems

Vidmer et al., 2015

A diffusion algorithm is used to predict the evolution of the multiproduct WTN, using a new measure of WTN fitness and product similarity.

Literature review

  • Complex network properties of the WTN first exhibited in Topology of the World Trade Web
  • Gravity model fitted to WTN in Gravity and Rich-Club Phenomenon
  • Product Space in The Product Space Conditions the Development of Nations + Economic Complexity in Hausmann et al. 2006
  • Export predictions done in Hummels and Klenow 2005
  • A recommender system can be used to predict future exports and exported products (The Product Space Conditions the Development of Nations, Tacchella et al. 2013, "A new measure for countries' fitness and product complexity")
    • Originally used in online systems/social media networks (Lv and Zhou 2011, "Link prediction in complex networks: a survey")
    • Use heat diffusion/mass diffusion model + economic complexity

Methods

  • NBER-UN dataset w/ 65 countries and 770 products
  • Matrix construction: if RCA>1RCA > 1RCA>1 for country iii and product α\alphaα, link exists
  • i,ji,ji,j denote countries, α,β\alpha,\betaα,β products
  • Links added from year ttt to t+1t+1t+1 is Ct\Ct+1C^t \backslash C^{t+1}Ct\Ct+1

Product space metrics

  • Proximity between two products ϕαβ\phi_{\alpha\beta}ϕαβ​ defined as

    min⁡(P(α∈Ci∣β∈Ci),P(β∈Ci∣α∈Ci))\min (P(\alpha \in C_i | \beta \in C_i), P(\beta \in C_i | \alpha \in C_i))min(P(α∈Ci​∣β∈Ci​),P(β∈Ci​∣α∈Ci​))

  • Proximity of country iii to product α\alphaα =

    1ki∑β∈Ciϕβα\frac{1}{k_i}\sum_{\beta \in C_i}\phi_{\beta \alpha}ki​1​β∈Ci​∑​ϕβα​

    where kik_iki​ is out-degree of iii.

  • Causality (newly defined) between α\alphaα and β\betaβ defined as

    number of times α and β were in the same country’s export baskettotal number of export baskets\frac{\text{number of times $\alpha$ and $\beta$ were in the same country's export basket}}{\text{total number of export baskets}}total number of export basketsnumber of times α and β were in the same country’s export basket​

    during a time period ttt.

  • Fitness and product complexity, defined iteratively.

Diffusion algorithm

  • Let fff be the vector containing the RCA information of country iii at time ttt:

    f=[ai1ai2⋮aiM]f = \begin{bmatrix} a_{i1} \\ a_{i2} \\ \vdots \\ a_{iM} \end{bmatrix}f=⎣⎡​ai1​ai2​⋮aiM​​⎦⎤​

    where there are MMM products and aiαa_{i\alpha}aiα​ is 111 if RCAiα>1RCA_{i\alpha} > 1RCAiα​>1, 000 otherwise.

  • The diffusion algorithm modifies fff based on

    fnew=Wff_{new} = Wffnew​=Wf

    where WWW is the product-to-product matrix with elements

    Wαβ=1kαλkβ1−λ∑j=1NajαajβkjW_{\alpha \beta} = \frac{1}{k_{\alpha}^\lambda k_{\beta}^{1-\lambda}}\sum_{j=1}^N \frac{a_{j \alpha} a _{j \beta}}{k_j}Wαβ​=kαλ​kβ1−λ​1​j=1∑N​kj​ajα​ajβ​​

    which can be interpreted as "all countries who export both α\alphaα and β\betaβ (ajαajβa_{j\alpha} a_{j\beta}ajα​ajβ​) give their resources evenly to all other countries".

  • Further multiply each fiαf_{i\alpha}fiα​ by ψiα\psi_{i\alpha}ψiα​, the causality averaged over the export basket of a country towards iii.

Link prediction

  • Prediction list built with top 20 products predicted by vector fff above to exceed RCA=1RCA = 1RCA=1

  • Consider: percentage of predictions that are correct (precision), percentage of actual added links correctly predicted (recall), average complexity rank of predicted products over a country, inter-list Hamming metric 1−qij(L)L1 - \frac{q_{ij}(L)}{L}1−Lqij​(L)​ where qijq_{ij}qij​ is the number of common products in the predicted and actual lists

  • Precision P=0.3P = 0.3P=0.3 for best-performing method (causality + diffusion)
